result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel E Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False emergency 9-1-1 call (2+ w/in 4 years), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 256.35(10)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
First 90 days to be served as Straight Time.
Balance to be served as Huber with Standard Release Conditions.
Apply 49 days.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate per Agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Domestic violence counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
6 months of Day Report Center (first 90 days of Day Report Center on SCRAM).

Case 14CF418 was dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED.
To be used a Agent's discretion and Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

records.addlTxt: CASH BOND AMENDED DOWN TO ZERO. Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Not to use 911 service unless its for a emgerency  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program and must report within 2 business days of release.

Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Daniel E Johnson in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.  Susan Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived. Attorney Bricco requested bail motion be heard. State has no objection to modification of bail. Court grants motion to modify bail.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Case to be scheduled before newly assigned court official.
Preliminary hearing on April 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
